DataElement.preferredName: Hepatic Artery Infusion Pump Other Vessels Ligated During Placement Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents another kind of vessel ligated during hepatic artery infusion pump (HAIP) placement not previously specified.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hepatic Artery Infusion Pump Blood Vessel Ligation During Placement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pump designed to administer chemotherapy directly to the liver via the hepatic artery._A tube through which the blood circulates in the body.  Blood vessels include a network of arteries, arterioles, capillaries, venules, and veins._The process of tying off blood vessels so that blood cannot flow to a part of the body or to a tumor._At some point in a given period of time._The act of putting something into a position or location.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pump designed to administer chemotherapy directly to the liver via the hepatic artery.

Concepts.definition: A pump designed to adminster chemotherapy directly to the liver via the hepatic artery.

Property.preferredDefinition: A tube through which the blood circulates in the body.  Blood vessels include a network of arteries, arterioles, capillaries, venules, and veins.:The process of tying off blood vessels so that blood cannot flow to a part of the body or to a tumor.:At some point in a given period of time.:The act of putting something into a position or location.

Concepts.definition: A tubular structure through which the blood circulates in the body. Blood vessels constitute a network composed of arteries, arterioles, capillaries, venules, and veins.
The process of tying off blood vessels so that blood cannot flow to a part of the body or to a tumor.
At some point in a given period of time.
The act of putting something into a position or location.
